title: 4 Incredible Markets to Visit During London Tours
text:
By Priyanka Manjari Mishra | Submitted On July 23, 2015 
London is one of the most popular travel destinations on the globe, attracting thousands of tourists from diverse lands every year. The capital of United Kingdom, once the centre of British imperial power, is called the city of dreams for its affluent historical and cultural heritage that it preserves. Set on the banks of river Thames, the city offers mesmerising views and picturesque locations with its beautiful gardens and parks, and monuments that testify its wealthy past. The charm of this cosmopolitan city of England can be explored with numerous London tours offered by travel agencies. This city is known for its exclusive markets, which cater to the varied interests of their customers. The Alfies Antique Market, Borough Market, Broadway market, Columbia Road Flowers market and Portobello Road market are among the most unique shopping areas of this cosmopolitan. 
Alfies Antique Market 
Located in Church Street, Marylebone, this antique marketplace opened in 1976, and is today one of the largest indoor markets for antiques, vintage as well as contemporary fashion in London. The interiors are decorated with a striking resemblance to Egyptian style of art. Formerly a departmental store, it accommodates at least 100 antique dealers, who sell rare accessories, jewellery, decorative arts and classic fashion. Tourists can spend hours in this market, browsing through the rarities sold here. The panoramic view of the British capital from the rooftop cafe provides a fulfilling experience to travellers visiting the city with London tour packages. 
Borough Market 
One of the most renowned food markets in London, Borough Market is located in Southwark, Central England. It comprises up to 70 stalls and stands, and is the largest as well as oldest food market in the urban centre. Producers from across the country come here to sell their products, including fresh fish, meats, vegetables, ciders, cheeses, breads and coffees. High-end products are a speciality of this market, which is a haven for all food lovers. Travellers, who are on the go, can also find countless takeaway stalls and bakeries here. 
Broadway Market 
Broadway market is among the oldest markets of the metropolis and displays a perfect amalgamation of taste and culture. A buzzing centre of the community, it comprises shops and galleries that sell an eclectic mix of goods, like local art, ceramics shops and fabrications selling unusual and exciting clothes and gifts. The organic meat, fish, salmons and oysters, and fresh fruits and vegetables are some of the reasons that tourists visit this spot. Tourists with an eye for new and different things can explore this place for a delightful shopping trip while exploring this city with London holidays packages. 
Portobello Road market 
One of the largest antique markets in the world, Portobello Road market is a combination of several markets. This street market is full of thousands of dealers selling an extensive selection of antiques. Easily accessible from the Notting Hill Gate, visitors come here for a variety of products, ranging from fruits and breads to posters and ceramics. Under the Westway flyover, lies this fashion market with vintage stalls and retro collectables. Stalls selling everything from headgear to musical instruments can also be found here in Portwine Arcade, a part of this shopping area. Shoppers can book London tour packages to explore the amazing markets of the cosmopolitan. 
A visit to these four bustling markets during London tours is a delight for globetrotters.
